page.title: 16The Coptic Church, Hampton
page.content: {St.Mary & St.Antony Church}of the Coptic Orthodox Patriarchate is situated in Butchers Road, Hampton. The building was originally erected in 1838 as a{Congregational Chapel}but was used more recently as a regional centre for the Women's Institute. In 1984 the building was bought by the Coptic Church and after extensive refurbishing was opened in 1985. The{Copts}are the present day Christians of Egypt and are the largest Christian minority in the Middle East. The Coptic Church was founded by St.Mark the Evangelist in {A.D.61}and played an active role in the early ecumenical church. It now belongs to the group of{Oriental} {Orthodox Churches.}The Coptic Church in Hampton serves the whole of the West Midlands and is the only Coptic Church in England outside London.
